basics.name: Manav Vora
basics.summary: Ph.D. Candidate in Aerospace Engineering at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

work.name: University of Illinois Urbana Champaign
work.summary: I am a researcher in the field of optimal planning and decision-making. I am passionate about developing efficient and scalable algorithms for massive multi-agent systems and robotics.

education.institution: Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT Bombay)
education.area: Aerospace Engineering (Honors); Minor in Systems and Control Engineering
courses: Motion Planning and Control of Autonomous Vehicles

awards.title: Department Fellowship

awards.title: Student Travel Award

awards.title: Chanakya Research Fellowship
awards.summary: Awarded for research on autopilot design for delivery drones.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
